summary:
Hypothyroidism is when your thyroid gland doesn't make enough thyroid hormones. This can make you feel tired, cold, and sad, and you might gain weight. It can also cause muscle pain and slow down your heart rate. Some people get a swollen neck called goiter.

The main cause worldwide is not getting enough iodine in your diet. In some countries, a condition called Hashimoto's thyroiditis is the most common cause. Treatment is with a pill that replaces the missing hormone. It's important to get checked if you think you have it, as it can affect your health and pregnancy.
title: Hypothyroidism
